name: The Poetry of Seeing - A Mindful Photography Session for Personal Journaling and Self-Expression
description:
A mindful photography session designed for personal journaling and self-expression. It invites you to slow down, observe closely, and tell quiet stories through images and words.
You don’t need a DSLR.
You need eyes that notice and a mind that pauses.
Bring a smartphone, a notebook, and your curiosity.
What to expect:
• A small, intimate gathering that fosters reflection and connection
• Framing feelings, not just objects — photography as emotional expression
• A guided photo walk through quiet corners (approx. 40 minutes)
• Simple yet powerful exercises in noticing and visual narration
• Thoughtful conversations around memory, image, presence, and self
Who can attend: If you find beauty in small things, enjoy writing down thoughts, or simply love quiet moments, this session is for you. No photography experience required.

name: 50 Above Fifty – India’s Biggest Senior Talent Event - Talent Hunt
description:
🪩 LIVE Auditions in Bengaluru! 🎶
Are you 50+ and ready to showcase your talent? Your stage awaits! 🌟
Step into the spotlight and take your first step towards becoming India's Senior Superstar at Khyaal’s 50 Above 50 – India’s biggest talent hunt for seniors!
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru
🎭 Choose your category — Singing, Dancing, Poetry, Art, Storytelling, Comedy & more!
🎁 Stand a chance to win exciting cash prizes
💰 Registration Fee: ₹999 only
🎉 Exclusive Benefits for Participants:
✅ Nominate yourself in 2 or more award categories
✅ Get 1-year FREE membership to the Khyaal Club — India’s largest club for seniors!
📲 Register now and let your talent shine: https://forms.gle/Pi8gwH4es8uN56nFA
💻 Pay online at www.50above50.com or at the venue.
🔗 For more details about the different categories, visit: https://www.50above50.com/categories

name: Queer Playtime for Adults! - Sensory Experience to Reconnect with your Inner Queer Child
description:
Queer Play Hour with Shruthi is here to bring back joy, giggles, chaos, and all the magical weird of your inner queer child!
🥭 This is a Neurodivergent-friendly space!
Come as you are — soft, loud, silly, shy, sparkly, or strange. Let’s imagine, move, laugh, and connect. 💫
Queers & Allies welcome! No prep needed, all materials provided.
🎟️ Limited spots. Grab your early bird ticket now!

name: Aro-Ace Meetup - Meetup
description: Peer support group for individuals on the aromantic / asexual spectrum, including those who are questioning!

name: Support Group - Support Group
description:
People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every wake of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.
This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.
The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore.This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Miles of Smiles - Book Launch
description:
Come meet the fabulous author, P. Bhanumathi, on Sunday, July 27th at 4:00 PM!
Hear the behind-the-scenes chaos—I mean story—of her award-winning travel fiction Miles of Smiles, and grab your signed copy before it flies off the shelves (just like her luggage or possibly even her).
Don’t miss this laugh-out-loud adventure that’ll make you want to book a holiday, pack richly, and travel with your bestie.
Warning: Bring your buddy, or you'll regret not having someone to elbow during the funny bits!

name: Where Hope Hurts - Book Launch
description:
With immense joy and gratitude, we invite you to the launch of Ankita Hundekar’s third book “Where Hope Hurts” a poignant tale woven with quiet resilience, raw emotion, and the ache of hope that lingers even in pain.
This book is not just a story.
It is a journey through shadows and light.
A reflection of how healing often begins where the hurt is the deepest.
Join us as we celebrate the words that refused to be silenced, and the woman who wrote them not just to be heard, but to be felt, and as Ankita turns yet another page in her literary journey.

name: This Is Not Therapy...But Kinda Is - Mental Health Workshop
description:
✨*A one-of-a-kind mental health workshop where self-reflection meets play.*✨
This isn’t your typical therapy session—it’s a space to explore your thoughts and feelings in a way that’s *honest, healing, and even a little fun.* Through a mix of creative activities, meaningful conversations, and light-hearted moments, you’ll get the chance to connect with yourself and others in a safe, supportive environment.
No pressure to be deep. No expectations to “fix” yourself —just come as you are, and leave feeling a little lighter, a little braver, and a lot more understood 💖🤗

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:

Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Bengaluru Poetry Festival 2025 - 9th Edition of the Bengaluru Poetry Festival
description:
The Bengaluru Poetry Festival is the city’s only literary event dedicated to poetry. Organized by the not-for-profit Bengaluru Poetry Festival trust, the event has seen eight successful years and has attracted thousands of poetry lovers each year.
The eight years of the festival has seen participation from over 450 poets, musicians, lyricists and performers and the programming has included Individual performances, Panel discussions, Workshops and Readings. The festival has brought poets and poetry from across the country, with substantial regional and ethnic flavours to the audiences of Bangalore.
The festival has grown to become a beloved fixture in the literary and cultural calendar of the city, and is now being recognised across the country.
The Bengaluru Poetry Festival was conceptualized as a celebration of all things poetry. From the classical to the modern, from hymn to haiku, from ballad to ode, poetry is what makes language dance. The rhyme, the rhythm, the words all merge into the perfect pitch, so we think and ache, and remain human.
The festival was conceptualized, when the founders of the festival realized that while poetry as a form of self-expression was gaining immense popularity, and Indian poets, and poetry were increasingly being recognized the world over, there were limited opportunities available for poets within existing literary festival platforms. Thus was born the Bengaluru Poetry Festival in 2016, a platform for poets, and poetry.
An inherent love for poetry brought the core team together – to plan this festival in a spirit of gratitude and joy, as a salute to poets and the magical, magical world of their compositions.

name: Children's Fest at the Bengaluru Poetry Festival - Children's Festival
description:
Welcome to the Children’s section of the Bengaluru Poetry Festival.
The events will begin from 10:30 AM and will run until 5:00 PM with a one-hour lunch break between 1 PM and 2 PM.
From interactions with Authors, Illustrators, Storytelling, Puppetry, Kamishibai, dance movement, theatre, spoken word, poetry, music, song writing, clowning, mime, magic, plays etc there is something for every child and family. Every 30 minutes there would be a different activity / engagement for the child and the family.
The events are open for children of all ages!

name: Qu For Quiz - Quiz
description:
The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided. 
SAMPLE Qu: 2. The name is inspired by the traditional malt whisky distillation process in which malted barley was mixed by hand with shovels. This labor-intensive process often caused a shoulder injury to workers, causing their arms to hang low. Which brand is named thus?
Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.com
Karthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Butter & Mashed Banana - Rehearsed Reading
description:
A right-wing zealot and a left-wing rebel walk into a protest... and accidentally fall in love.
What follows is a pregnancy no ideology could predict and a child born into a country already arguing over his first words. Butter & Mashed Banana is a razor-sharp, rhythm-driven satire about censorship, identity, and inherited confusion.
Through music, mockery and just enough movement to keep the chairs from revolting, it tells the story of a boy trapped between extremes - political, parental and poetic - who grows up to commit the most dangerous act of all: writing. Funny, furious and gloriously nonsensical, this theatrical reading asks - in a world obsessed with sides, can a voice still speak from the middle?

name: Inheriting Shadows: Children of the Atom - Spoken Word and Performance Poetry
description:
One story. Nine perspectives. Told entirely through poetry.
History is never just one truth. On the 80th Anniversary of the Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, this event brings together nine powerful voices to tell the story of invention, destruction, and inheritance—from the birth of the atomic bomb to the shadows it left behind.
Einstein hated guns, yet his work led to the deadliest weapon ever.
Oppenheimer built the bomb—but Germany was building one too.
A pilot sat alone for 12 hours with the bomb. What went through his mind?
Children born of radiation—who do they blame? Their ancestors or their enemies?
9 perspectives. 9 haunting truths.
Some of Bangalore’s best poets bring them to life.
Tickets cost less than a burger. The story you’ll witness is priceless.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Dispensers of India's Destiny - Book Launch
description:
📖 About the Book
Dispensers of India’s Destiny is an alternate history novel that reimagines India in a world where the Axis Powers won World War II.
In this reality, Subhas Chandra Bose leads an unpartitioned, newly independent India - caught between the competing ambitions of Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan, who have divided the globe into rival spheres of influence.
Through the lens of alternate history, Dispensers of India’s Destiny explores themes of patriotism, power, and the fragile promise of freedom.
🎤 What to Expect
•         Insightful conversation with the author on his book writing journey
•         Live Q&A with the audience
•         Exclusive book signing session
•         Light refreshments & networking
•         Be among the first 10 to register and join us in person to get a special launch day souvenir!
Whether you’re a reader, a writer, or simply someone who loves to wonder about “what ifs”, this event promises imagination, reflection, and a shared sense of patriotism.
🪶 About the Author
Tanmay Agarwal is a history buff, and an avid quizzer with a deep interest in international diplomacy. Born in Agra and having worked across the globe, he blends a love for logic with a flair for vivid imagination. A keen student of Indian history, his work explores the turning points where nations are remade or undone. His storytelling delves into ambition, betrayal, and the decisions that define freedom. Tanmay believes in agency over inevitability, and in fates shaped by intent, not by chance.
Dispensers of India’s Destiny is a gripping narrative, born of his enduring curiosity about history’s crossroads and the paths that could have been.
📚 Books will be available for purchase at the venue.

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
The next dates for Queer Quiet Hours are here!  
Queer Quiet Hours is back — a cozy space to rest, make art, and just be. No pressure to talk, no need to perform. Just soft community vibes and gentle company. Bring your own project or come as you are. We'll have plenty of art stuff for you to use.
✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.

🆓 Free to join. Limited spots.

📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

Spots are limited - Sign up!

name: A Karukku Norukku Time - Storytime
description: Guru absolutely loves the sound that murukkus make - KARUKKU NORUKKU! KARUKKU NORUKKU! Come find out if Guru manages to sneakily eat an entire packet of munchies – without sharing, that is!

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: We Fed the Whale A Greenhouse - Book Discussion
description:
The AG Lit Sisters invite you to an intimate evening with award-winning journalist and debut author Sonali Prasad, as we dive into her lyrical and poignant novel Glass Bottom, a story of two pairs of mothers and daughters who reside by the sea, navigating the silent intensity of love, loss, legacy, and everything in between.
Set against the shifting tides of the coastline, Glass Bottom offers a tender meditation on relationships, memory, and healing. In this special session, Sonali will read a short excerpt from the novel, followed by a heartfelt Q&A and book discussion with readers.
📚 Hosted by AG Lit Sisters
🎤 In collaboration with Pan Macmillan India
Whether you're drawn to stories that stir your soul or conversations that linger long after they end, this is a session you won’t want to miss.
SONALI PRASAD was born and raised in New Delhi, India. Her journalism has appeared in publications such as the Guardian, Washington Post, Hakai Magazine, Quartz and Esquire Singapore. She has been awarded a Pulitzer Traveling Fellowship, Global TED Fellowship, MIT Knight Science Journalism
Fellowship, Logan Science Journalism Fellowship and a Jan Michalski Writing Residency, among other grants and honours.
Glass Bottom is her first book.
performer:
Dr. Chhavi Gandhi Juneja, 
Sonali Prasad,
